cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest toward Hispaniola, the Bahamas, and eventually the south-east coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida coast (near Palm Beach County) or immediate offshore waters

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the Central Bahamas (Cat Island, Exumas, Long Island, Rum Cay, San Salvador)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings extend across Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and the SE Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, and the southeast U.S. coastline from south Florida northward to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 kt, gusts 50-60 kt) possible in the Palm Beach area beginning late Friday night or early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground level possible along the immediate coast and intracoastal waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts, causing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of and during the storm’s passage.
